byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Matthew Rosenberg and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Iraqi government announces major military operation to drive Islamic State from Anbar Province; American-led coalition steps up airstrikes in support of effort.
lead_paragraph: A United-States-led coalition carried out 39 airstrikes in Iraq overnight, but it was unclear if the Iraqi operation would have the support of various tribal forces.

headline.main: Iraq Begins Military Operation to Drive ISIS From Anbar Province
headline.print_headline: Iraq Begins Operation to Drive ISIS From West

snippet: A United-States-led coalition carried out 39 airstrikes in Iraq overnight, but it was unclear if the Iraqi operation would have the support of various tribal forces.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
